meanings.definition: To attach or fix a hinge to something again.
meanings.sent1: She had to rehinge the door after it fell off.
meanings.sent2: He rehinged the cabinet door to make it close properly.
meanings.sent3: The rehinging of the gate made it swing like new.
meanings.sent4: Rehinging the window opened up new possibilities for ventilation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rehinging echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To put a new hinge on something.
meanings.sent1: They decided to rehinge the old chest for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: After the repair, they rehinged the gate with a sturdy hinge.
meanings.sent3: She surprised him by rehinging his favorite box with a golden hinge.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter rehinged the cabinet door with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: The rehinging of the door transformed its appearance.

meanings.definition: The act of attaching or fixing a hinge again.
meanings.sent1: The rehinging of the door was necessary for safety.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the rehinging of the window during the renovation.
meanings.sent3: The rehinging of the gate became a topic of discussion among neighbors.
meanings.sent4: She admired the craftsmanship of the rehinging on the antique chest.
meanings.sent5: The rehinging of the cabinet door improved its functionality.
